publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-4811 Karen Gillon: Clydesdale Parks—That the Parliament welcomes the decision by the Heritage Lottery Fund to award over £1.3 million to help renovate Castlebank Park and Delves Park in Lanark; congratulates South Lanarkshire Council on its ambitious proposals to significantly improve access, interpretation and learning opportunities at the two historic parks; believes that restoration of the 18th century walled garden, the reinstatement of the glasshouses and the development of a multi-sports play area will attract many new visitors and increase community involvement in local history, gardening and other activities, and looks forward to the parks playing an important role in celebrations such as Lanimer Day, the medieval fayre and other special events in the future. Supported by: Donald Gorrie*

S2M-4811 Karen Gillon: Clydesdale Parks—That the Parliament welcomes the decision by the Heritage Lottery Fund to award over £1.3 million to help renovate Castlebank Park and Delves Park in Lanark; congratulates South Lanarkshire Council on its ambitious proposals to significantly improve access, interpretation and learning opportunities at the two historic parks; believes that restoration of the 18th century walled garden, the reinstatement of the glasshouses and the development of a multi-sports play area will attract many new visitors and increase community involvement in local history, gardening and other activities, and looks forward to the parks playing an important role in celebrations such as Lanimer Day, the medieval fayre and other special events in the future. Supported by: Donald Gorrie

S2M-4811*#* Karen Gillon: Clydesdale Parks—That the Parliament welcomes the decision by the Heritage Lottery Fund to award over £1.3 million to help renovate Castlebank Park and Delves Park in Lanark; congratulates South Lanarkshire Council on its ambitious proposals to significantly improve access, interpretation and learning opportunities at the two historic parks; believes that restoration of the 18th century walled garden, the reinstatement of the glasshouses and the development of a multi-sports play area will attract many new visitors and increase community involvement in local history, gardening and other activities, and looks forward to the parks playing an important role in celebrations such as Lanimer Day, the medieval fayre and other special events in the future. Motions and amendments which have attracted additional support
S2M-4811# Clydesdale Parks (lodged on 19 September 2006) Scott Barrie*, Jackie Baillie*, Mrs Mary Mulligan*, Helen Eadie*, Trish Godman*, Robin Harper*, Sarah Boyack*, Mr Frank McAveety*
S2M-4811# Clydesdale Parks (lodged on 19 September 2006) Chris Ballance*, Mr Brian Monteith*
S2M-4811# Clydesdale Parks (lodged on 19 September 2006) John Swinburne*, Ms Rosemary Byrne*

S2M-4811# Karen Gillon: Clydesdale Parks—That the Parliament welcomes the decision by the Heritage Lottery Fund to award over £1.3 million to help renovate Castlebank Park and Delves Park in Lanark; congratulates South Lanarkshire Council on its ambitious proposals to significantly improve access, interpretation and learning opportunities at the two historic parks; believes that restoration of the 18th century walled garden, the reinstatement of the glasshouses and the development of a multi-sports play area will attract many new visitors and increase community involvement in local history, gardening and other activities, and looks forward to the parks playing an important role in celebrations such as Lanimer Day, the medieval fayre and other special events in the future. Supported by: Donald Gorrie, Scott Barrie, Jackie Baillie, Mrs Mary Mulligan, Helen Eadie, Trish Godman, Robin Harper, Sarah Boyack, Mr Frank McAveety, Chris Ballance, Mr Brian Monteith, John Swinburne, Ms Rosemary Byrne
